meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one millionth of a meter.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a microscope to measure the tiny object in microns.
meanings.sent2: The hair's thickness was measured in microns.
meanings.sent3: The micron on the ruler decided to go on strike, causing chaos in the lab.
meanings.sent4: Every micron of progress brought them closer to their goal.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering sand grains sparkled under the microscope, each one a tiny micron of beauty.

meanings.sent1: She noticed a micron of dust on the bookshelf.
meanings.sent2: The chef carefully removed every micron of eggshell from the batter.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy sprinkled microns of glitter all over the room.
meanings.sent4: His words carried weight, each one a micron of truth in a sea of lies.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstroke added a micron of color to the canvas, bringing the painting to life.
